campaign.story:
Thank you all for a wonderful campaign! We look forward to releasing the Pledge manager by the end of May so you can make your choices and add you add on's. 
 The unlocked Stretch Goals and Special Pricing will be good through July 6th, then some stretch goals may go away and some prices may go up, so please fill out your surveys before July 6th. Big fun is coming your way!
 Links of past Q & A at the bottom of the page.  
A game topper is all about FUN!!!! "Surely, you do not have 4 plump chickens." "Don't call me Shirley" Sheriff of Nottingham from Arcane Wonders on a Holmes Model topper
Transform your existing table into a High Quality portable gaming solution that upgrades every game you play.
Game Toppers 3.0 is launching to build on and improve our first  two successfully delivered projects. It has taken dedicated effort, working with industry insiders and professional engineers to develop Game Toppers 3.0 improvements and new products. This thoughtfully designed solution keeps affordability in mind, but also provides special features gamers desire while not sacrificing quality. Our standard Game Toppers provide a solid, high quality, powder coated aluminum rail that is very durable at a lower price while not sacrificing functionality. Our "New LUXURIANT & PREMIUM" options provide that extra luxury feel and look with all Natural Oak and Premium Walnut hardwood components. ...And now we have "NEW " Leg kits and Dining covers for the full table experience!
The Game Topper System provides Modular Collapsible Cup Holders & Accessories 
 Powder Coat Finish & Premium Wood Finishes to ensure durability
 Military Grade Aluminum for precise tolerances and strength
 3mm Premium Stitched Thematic Gaming Mats enhance the gaming experience
 Stable "non-slip" Performance while protecting your existing table's surface with our soft rubberized protection strips
 Optional Accessory Rail converts the larger Toppers into a mini. You can have 2 Toppers in one. 
 Fully Assembled - Sets up in just a couple of minutes.
Optional Leg Kit solutions and Dining covers
Made in the USA
 USA, Canada, Australia, UK, & EU friendly shipping and VAT 
 This is a detailed video about the construction, product availability, and functionality of our system showing off some of the new innovations that are backward compatible and our new game mat offerings. 
3 Styles to choose from in most styles
 The Lestrade is a great topper at a great price. Perfect size for smaller games or card games. 
Click on Lestrade banner to see popular games set up.
 The Adler is a great topper to fit in smaller spaces while giving plenty of room for a good amount of popular games, easily accommodating Ticket to Ride size games. 
Click on Adler banner to see popular games set up.
Our number 1 selling Watson is just a wonderful size for 90 percent of the games out there.
Click on Watson banner to see popular games set up.
 Great for 4 ft Square or oval tables, add a 24 Mycroft extension and it becomes a 4 x 6 Mycroft. 
Click on Moriarty banner to see popular games set up.

 The Holmes was designed for game stores, convention booths for use with standard 30" x 72" folding tables, but great on your dining table too.  
Click on Holmes banner to see popular games set up.
 The Mycroft is perfect for the big epic miniatures games like Warhammer and Song of Fire and ICE with its 3 - 24" segments essentially giving you 2 toppers in one. The Moriarty & Mycroft  
Click on Mycroft banner to see popular games set up.
  Limited edition Hand Signed (by Burky) sculpted Dragon and Viking rail toppers in two sizes. 
Sculpted Topper come with Padded Storage Bag
Sculpted Topper come with Padded Storage Bag
Easy assembly video coming
 Leg kit install video and XL leaf leg kit support test. See if it can hold a Burky????
We are working on 24" extension ideas too. These are screw in removable legs
See Packages and Stretch Goals for KS special prices.
Save hundreds on our packages pledges
 Items unlocked in packages.
Not only do you get 2 mats at a discount you get 2 premium mat storage bags with clear windows FREE, plus discounted shipping saving you an extra $10.00
  Our Accessory Rails convert half of your topper or both halves into mini smaller Topper 
See rail bundle stretch goals below unlocked!!!
This is not an additional 2 storage bags it just shows the storage bags included in the bundle.

 Some unlocked Stretch Goals have been moved up the page next to relevant products. 
You did it!!!!! Thank you all so much!!!

If you pledge for the dining cover you do not need to purchase this as it is one of the end pieces.
If you would be willing to fill out the survey and rank your mats (really simple I think with survey monkey link by clicking the banner or the link above) https://www.surveymonkey.com/r/QTL72DD

  April 24th, Q & A #1 video. We answer questions and welcome our backers to the campaign items.
April 28th. In our second live Q & A # 2 we discuss in depth the leg kit and XL Leg kits Testing results.  My Daughter and Graphics artist Hannah Wagner joins us.
 Q & A # 3 with special guest Raymond Haaken from Board Game Heaven
 Live Q & A #4 launched 5-4-21 on YouTube. We talk about the dining cover and more. 
Live Q & A # 5 We had Special Guest Jamie Keagy from The Secret cabal Gaming Podcast join us and talk about Conventions, relationships and how Game Toppers has impacted his gameplay. Super fun!
 We are Super excited to have Mark Maia from Board Game Coffee join us during our Live Q & A # 7 
 We are Super excited to have Rory Veronda from Empire Board Game Library. In Q & A # 7 we talk about retail stores and how Game toppers has helped Empire board game library 
We had a great time talking about new mat ideas with Mark Streed from The Dice Tower in our Game Toppers live Q & A # 8.
 We are Super excited to have Randy &Ellen from We Game Together tonight Monday 6PM CDT join us to talk about gaming as a family, how Game Toppers has impacted their play, and of course answer your questions on Game Toppers live Q & A # 9.
 We are Super excited to have BJ shea on the Show today 2:30 CDT join us to talk about gaming, geek culture, how Game Toppers has impacted his play, and of course answer your questions on Game Toppers live Q & A # 10.  Also, some big last day news!!!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As a seasoned business owner, I understand how things do not always go as planned. 2020 was definitely an example of that! There are some factors which are out of one's control, and human error must always be factored in. When this happens, problem solving and a commitment to make things right is paramount. I always endeavor to give the customer more than they expect with no gotchas. My experience has prepared me for this and my commitment to honoring my word is my main priority. Our backers will attest to the quality of response and service we provide. 

Manufacturing and supply chain difficulties are the biggest risk to this project. We have taken several steps to minimize this risk:

First, I have been involved significantly in every step of this project from inception; prototyping, working with qualified engineers, costing and quality control of manufacturing. I went so far as to personally finance, at significant expense, an initial low volume run of tables to make sure these tables did what I said they would, and to ensure that we could manufacture these with the quality I expect. The result was a product I am very proud of. This knowledge and being so active in the "day to day processes" allows me to personally oversee this project.

Secondly, our Game Toppers are made in the USA. I am working with a manufacture that is based in my home town. They have many large accounts like Target, Best Buy and others, in a 90,000 square ft. facility, that has equipped them to handle the quality and the capacity this project demands. It also provides us many key advantages as far as quality control, problem solving, supply chain and mitigating problems that can happen versus manufacturing overseas.

Thirdly, shipping is always a challenge. We have purchased a 5000 Sq ft facility in our home town to manage inventory and the pick and pull process of our topper orders which we have been running on our own since Feb of 2019. Our Game Toppers are somewhat heavy packages. Considerable time and effort has gone into making sure our fulfillment partner in the EU can handle the shipping in a timely manner. We also have been testing our packaging to ensure our Toppers arrive in pristine condition. Because of this I have made significant upgrades in our packaging to ensure a quality delivery. our second delivered campaign has seen lower shipping failure and improved response time due to our implementations.

We are charging for shipping. I am making sound business decisions so I have enough funds to pay to get them to you. Our Toppers are over sized for the shipping category. The world is currently upside down in this segment or economy, and it's a worldwide problem. We see it easing in the future, but have prepared for the worst to ensure we can stand by our commitments. Our improvements in package engineering have proven well worth it! While we realize it costs a bit more to ship, this was an intentional design decision to provide the best quality, comfort and functionality that gamers desire. We could have made a smaller Topper with 2 inch rails and not offered the versatility that our design offers, but I refused to compromise on this. The small amount of extra shipping, I feel is worth it in the long run.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

support.title: À la carte - Accessory Pledge
support.descp:
This pledge level is for Backers looking for add on accessories which do not have their own pledge level.
Simply add up the value of the items you are looking to get and then pledge that dollar amount! When our Backerkit pledge manager launches after the campaign you will be able to then select your choice of accessories using the funds previously pledged. You will also be able to add on any additional items not covered by your KS pledge amount.
Shipping will vary based on items selected, quantity of items, and destination country. For our current best estimates check out our shipping charts at the bottom of the Kickstarter page.
INCLUDES:
Mat Bundles
Rail Bundles
Extension Leaf Bundles
Leg Kits
Dining Covers
Other Add Ons

updates.update_userinfo: Pledge Manager Surveys are on their way!
updates.update_content:
Hello Game Topper Nation! 

We have launched our Pledge Manager, so you should be getting an email shortly with the link to your Pledge Survey. This will walk you through a step by step process to select your pledge level rewards and then also any add-on items you would like as well!

updates.update_userinfo: Live Game Toppers 3.0 celebration and Pledge Manager Launch Q & A today 12 noon CDT 6-4-21
updates.update_content:
Greetings Game Topper Nation!

Quick reminder:
Come join us Live today 12 noon CDT to celebrate the ending of our 3rd Kickstarter and the Launch of the Pledge Manager! We will answer any questions you have about your surveys and have a fun time together. https://youtu.be/DLAFvxre8iA

updates.update_userinfo: First Backerkit smoke test underway. 6-1-21
updates.update_content:
Greetings Game Topper Nation.
The first Backerkit pledge surveys are underway. The smoke test is about 5 percent of total backers to see if there are any glitches.
We’ve scoured over it many times so we hope we have it correct, but it’s always good to wait 24 hours for people to fill in their surveys to see if there’s any issues. Please let us know if you receive your survey and are having any difficulties.

updates.update_userinfo: What's next? After campaign update. 5-23-21
updates.update_content:
Greetings Game Topper Nation!
Wow! What an amazing last few day surge! I knew it was going to really be a stretch to hit our goals, (See what I did there?)but you did it!!!!! Thanks so much for your support, it is truly spectacular!!! 
1622 % funded!!! 1668 Backers!!! 48 stretch Goals(I think)!!! We have to celebrate that!!!

updates.update_userinfo: Final 20 hours! New Stretch Goals and items announced! 5-19-20
updates.update_content:
We are at $730,000! Only 20 hours left! 
We had an amazing fun time with BJ Shea fron Geek Nation Podcast today.
Check it out. We talked about mats, answered a lot of questions and even talked Star Trek! 
Check it out!

updates.update_userinfo: LAST 45 Hours!!!! Last Q & A #10 with special guest BJ Shea 5-18-21
updates.update_content:
Greetings Game Topper Nation!!!
ONLY 45 hours left! I thought I'd put out an update. I've been up since 5AM as I was excited to join a group of fine folks (Sarah, Conor and Steven) at Board Game BBQ in Australia! What a fun group!! Their show drops Wed night 7PM CDT. Secret: I made an oath! Check them out.
NEWS:

updates.update_userinfo: 5-16-20 New Final stretch Goals Released! Only 3 Days Left! Live Q & A #9 with Randy and Ellen Kirby Monday night 6PM CDT
updates.update_content:
Greetings Game Topper Nation!
I hope you all had a great weekend. I mowed the lawn. I love doing that! I counted my hours. That means you have been working way too much! How many hours do you think I worked this week?
Oh well, I do it because I am pushing to get the word out everywhere I can and make this dream of upgrading everyone's gaming experience! Maybe it's corny or sounds like a sales pitch, but I get regular messages thanking me for making this product and helping make a dream come true for so many people. It really does fuel and drive me! Doing what we do is incredible hard. Then, I go and add more stuff to make it even more cool! Well, I have more in my bag of tricks. Due to the crazy time last year gave us and supply problems, I wasn't able to make everything happen all at once, but this Kickstarter is what is needed for me to continue to accomplish what is my heart for the future.

updates.update_userinfo: Mat survey results revealed! Live Q & A with Mark Streed 1PM CDT Friday
updates.update_content:
Greetings Game Topper Nation!
Again, I want to thank you all for the great support and encouragement. Running a campaign is a amazing task. The encouragement and great stories you are all sharing has meant the world to us. This idea didn't come with a desire to get rich (and we haven't) but to upgrade people's gaming experiences. We are doing that and you made that happen!!! Thank you from the bottom of my heart.

updates.update_userinfo: Blowing through Stretch Goals! NEW ones listed! New XL mat survey. New Q & A Wed 1PM CDT with Special Guest Rory Veronda
updates.update_content:
Greetings Game Topper Nation!!!
We are blowing through some great values being added to the campaign and some really cool ones added. Thanks you for all the energy and encouragement it means a lot to see the community come together.

Live Q & A with Rory Veronda from Empire Board Game Library. 1PM CDT Wed 5-12-21

project_data.project_name: Game Toppers 3.0 - Upgrading Every Game You play

campaign.story:
Retailers will be verified during the post campaign pledge manager. To qualify for the retailer pledge level, retailers must own a physical store selling hobby games and must have a space open to the public (or be offering curbside pick up where required due to health restrictions). Online only sellers will not qualify and will not be shipped retailer bundles of the game. The retailer pledge level is not for group pledges.  If you have questions, please contact us directly. 
My Father's Work is a worker-placement euro board game in which 2-4 players are competing mad scientists entrusted with a page from their father's journal, along with a large estate in which to perform their devious experiments. Players earn points by completing Experiments, aiding the Town in its endeavors, upgrading their macabre Estates, and hopefully completing their Father's Work in this app-driven branching-narrative game.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Renegade Game Studios is an experienced publisher of board games. While Renegade is only 6 years old, it is composed of industry veterans including Scott Gaeta, President of Renegade, with over 20 years of experience in all aspects of the industry.

While there are always risks associated with any campaign, we will make sure that we communicate any delays or challenges we may experience along the way. We are already past many of the hurdles that can delay a project and do not expect any major delays. If we do, they will likely be in shipping and we will give you regular and detailed updates regarding any shipping issues.

Thank you for supporting our project!

Find out more about Renegade Game Studios at www.renegadegames.com
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Look for your CrowdOx Pledge Manager Invites today!
updates.update_content:
Greetings & Salutations Scientists!
We have teamed up with the kind people over at Crowd Ox to send you an extremely simple survey in order to collect the info we need to fulfill your rewards. You should expect to receive the invitation today. The entire process should only take a couple of minutes to complete.
The invitation will be sent directly to the email address linked to your Kickstarter account. If you don't see it today, be sure to check your spam folder in case it was captured there!

updates.update_userinfo: Thank you for helping us acheive this masterwork!
updates.update_content:
Greetings Scientists and friends!
My Father's Work is our most successful campaign and we have all of you to thank for that. You have brought enthusiasm, excitement, and so much positivity to this campaign and we are excited to continue to build the community around this game! We finished this campaign with more than double our previous highest backer count, and we have exceeded our previously highest-funded campaign by more than $200k!

updates.update_userinfo: The last 24-hours are almost upon us!
updates.update_content:
Greetings Scientists!
We are almost down to the last 24-hours of this campaign, and what an exciting this campaign has been! Thank you all for your support so far!
Let's finish with a Masterwork!

updates.update_userinfo: The clock is ticking down! Just over 48 Hours to go!
Another bonus upgrade!
updates.update_content:
Greetings and salutations scientists! 
We're in the final days of this Kickstarter campaign and what an amazing ride it's been so far! We couldn't be happier with this wonderful community we are building with you. All of your enthusiasm, excitement, and energy means the world to our whole team and we thank you!
A GIANT surprise!

support.title: Name in Credits
support.descp: There's always a long list of people at the end of a movie. We want to put you in that list because without you we wouldn't be able to make this movie. Ten dollars isn't easy for a lot of people to come by, especially these days and we want to thank you!

support.title: Digital Download of the Documentary
support.descp: When we finish the film, we'll send you a copy of the doc right to your inbox. And of course we'll also put your name in the credits.

support.title: Film-Maker Meetup
support.descp: If Nashville is open for business we'd like to meet up over a cup of coffee and chat, or we could zoom or do a Instagram live or how ever you want to chat. All this social distancing has us itching to meet people.

support.title: Larkspur Memorial
support.descp: We have a very special plan for part of the final film and we'd like to make you a part of this if you've lost someone to addiction. We will email you the details and coordinate the best way to include your loved one's name in the most respectful way as part of a memorial service for lives lost to this deadly disease.

support.title: Private Digital Screener
support.descp: Sure, we'll send you a digital copy of the final documentary and thank you in the credits but we'd also like to have a private screening online before the film is finalized. Screenings can really help our team see where parts of the story don't quite add up or make sense. We'll watch an early version of the film with a few of you and ask for your feedback on what was good or bad about the film.

support.title: Signed book from Author David Hampton
support.descp: Our Producer David Hampton is not only a Certified Professional Recovery Coach... He's also got books. One of those books, After the Miracle, is one of the most beautiful and honest accounts of finding sobriety and serenity written... In the opinion of our film's Director.

support.title: Stigma Crew T-shirt
support.descp: Stigma the Doc crew T-Shirt along with being a part of the private screening because, if you're gonna be crew you need to have some input on the screener! And of course we'll add your name in the credits.

support.title: Signed Photo by Byron Jorjorian
support.descp: Byron Jorjorian is not only one of the great nature photographers living today with his work displayed all over America, he is also our Cinematographer's mentor. Byron will provide a signed print of his work at Larkspur to a limited number of people.

support.title: Guided Tour of Larkspur
support.descp: The director of Larkspur will take you and a guest on a private guided tour of the near 200 acre preserve.

support.title: EB Rooster Guitar
support.descp: This is a one of a kind, handmade guitar from EB Rooster Guitar. As the central story of our documentary you will have a guitar from Dan Blom.

support.title: À la carte - Accessory Pledge
support.descp:
This pledge level is for Backers looking for accessories which do not have their own pledge level.
Simply add up the value of the items you are looking to get and then pledge that dollar amount! When our Backerkit pledge manager launches after the campaign you will be able to then select your choice of accessories using the funds previously pledged. You will also be able to add on any additional items not covered by your KS pledge amount.
Shipping:
Shipping will vary based on items selected, quantity of items, and destination country. For our current best estimates check out our shipping charts at the bottom of the Kickstarter page. Shipping for orders outside the continental United States are good faith estimates and will vary slightly due to location. Final shipping will be listed in our post campaign survey. All tax, VAT and customs charges will be the responsibility of the backer and charged in the Backerkit Late pledge survey. MN sales tax will be charged for MN Residents.

                                                                                                                         GDPR and Data/Privacy Protection law
By pledging on this campaign, you give us the right to transfer your personal data to select partners, in the sole purpose of sending you your games. Your data won't be sold or transferred to partners who don't need it. In details, will get your personal data:
us, Lucky Duck Games, to transfer it to the partners who will need it
a Pledge Manager solution (not chosen yet) to collect your shipping address and pledge preferences
the fulfillment company in charge of shipping the game to you (we'll work with Quartermaster Logistics, Snakes&Lattes, HappyShops, Meeple Logistics and AetherWorks)
the transporter chosen by the fulfillment company to deliver you the game
By personal data, we mean:
name and surname
email address
phone number
postal address
While we don't know at this time all the partners we will choose for this campaign, we will make sure they are GDPR compliant and will not sell or transfer your data without your authorization.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Cards being the main component, it means that this project has a lower level of risk than others, particularly those with lots of miniatures.

That being said, outside of making sure that the game is properly prepared and choosing our partners wisely (printers, logistics, etc.), it is not impossible that we face delays from uncontrollable sources. This may cause some delay in the delivery date but rest assured that, if this were to happen, we will keep you informed about the situation.

Refund Policy

All pledges can be refunded up to the completion of the Pledge Manager, no questions asked. 
If the refund is asked more than 60 days after the end of the Kickstarter campaign, 10% will be deducted from the amount (corresponding to the charges incurred by Kickstarter and Stripe, since we will not be refunded of them at that point), and the refund will have to be done via PayPal instead of the Credit Card you used on Stripe.

Terms and Conditions

Any costs shown in EUR are based on the exchange rate in effect during the first day of the campaign, and may change during the campaign. The price reference to consider is the price in USD. 
By pledging to this Kickstarter, you acknowledge that the final appearance, materials and content of the rewards (and the Kickstarter) are subject to change and may differ substantially from what is presented while the Kickstarter project is active.

You agree that our responsibility to you is to ship your reward as entered into our pledge manager system, that title and risk passes to you upon delivery to a common carrier for such shipment, and you are responsible for import duties or any other duties that may be payable to the relevant tax authorities, providing correct address information and ensuring this address is deliverable by normal methods.

Thank you!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Approaching full closure & need your help!
updates.update_content:
Fellow Pilots,
Approaching full closure
With EU, US and Asia all completed, we were waiting for Canadian backers to finally receive their pledge! We are happy to report that Snakes & Lattes is processing and shipping them today!

updates.update_userinfo: CA backers: 48h left to update your address! // Shipping update worldwide
updates.update_content:
Fellow Pilots,
CA backers: 48h left to update your address!
We're in the last stretch of process to have the games sent from the US to Canada. That means we need to lock the backers list and you have 48h left to update your address if you need to! Please either send us a private message on Kickstarter or an email (info@luckyduckgames.com) to have it changed. If you are moving within the next 1-4 weeks, we strongly recommend that you give us the address of a friend or family member instead.

updates.update_userinfo: EU & Rest of the World backers: 48h left to update your address + Worldwide shipping update
updates.update_content:
Fellow Pilots,
EU & Rest of the World backers: 48h left to update your address
The games have arrived at port in Gdansk, Poland! We are waiting to pass customs, but then it will be a single day transport to get them to our first fulfillment center, which will then be sending the games to other fuflillment centers in Germany and France.

updates.update_userinfo: AU/NZ backers: 48h left to update your address
updates.update_content:
Fellow Pilots,
AU/NZ backers: 48h left to update your address
Jetpack Joyride is arriving today in Adelaide, and will now pass customs. It means it's time for us to wrap up the corresponding list of backers, and therefore we give 48h to all backers in Australia and New Zealand to update their address!

updates.update_userinfo: US backers: 48h left to update your address
updates.update_content:
Fellow Pilots, 
US backers: 48h left to update your address
Jetpack Joyride is expected to arrive to port in Florida on August 20th, which means it's time for us to lay down the preparations for fulfillment. Part of it is giving the backers list to our US partner, Quartermaster Logistics.

updates.update_userinfo: Shipping Update!
updates.update_content:
Fellow Pilots,
Shipping Update!
USA: Your games are arriving in Florida August 20th! Please count about 3 extra weeks for custom, inventory and preparation of fullfilement by Quartermaster Logistic!

updates.update_userinfo: Asian backers: last call to update your address
updates.update_content:
Fellow pilots,
Asian backers: make sure your address is up-to-date!
We've officially given the quantities of games per shipment to the factory who are now preparing them. The first wave of games to be sent will be to Asian backers (list of specific countries below), and will be done by , based in China. In order to make sure it's done smoothly, we will shortly be giving them the list of orders to fulfill, ahead of time, so they can prepare properly and accordingly on their side.

updates.update_userinfo: Assembly is in progress!
updates.update_content:
Fellow pilots,
Assembly is in progress!
We are excited to share with you some further progress.
We have received a pre-production copy of every single boxes, and we are happy to report that everything was perfect! After almost a year of project management and iteration, it is a huge relief for the team to finally have this moving forward.

updates.update_userinfo: Assembly Starting Soon and New Schedule
updates.update_content:
Fellow Pilots,
Assembly Starting Soon and New Schedule
So following the full approval of all materials of the game (finally!!!) we are now waiting for an official pre-production copy of each version in each language to ensure that our manufacturer has understood what goes where. We are expecting to receive such samples next week.

updates.update_userinfo: Development Update - May 2019 #1
updates.update_content:
Fellow Pilots,
Development Update - May 2019 #1
Given this is our first project that is late, out of the 8 KS we ever ran, we have decided to provide updates as often as possible to keep you on top of the latest status rather than doing a monthly sum up.

campaign.story:
Days of Discovery is the first game in a multi-game series. It is a card game that comes with 108 poker-sized cards and involves card drafting, hand management, resource management, and some secret scoring. The theme is the discovery of new land during the middle ages.
It can be played with 1-6 players (solo mode, or 2 to 6 competing players), in 30 to 60 minutes.
A $29 pledge earns you a copy of the game, including shipping within the U.S. There are a couple of fun "put your face in the game" pledge tiers available as well.
Delivery is expected by November.
Now EU-Friendly!! I have found a Germany-based fulfillment partner to ship games through for our EU-based backers!
The game consists entirely of cards -- 6 Sponsors, plus 102 multi-use People cards, totaling 27 unique characters.
The object of the game is to score the most points while completing a voyage to the Land of Danger. To get there, players will step through the 3 Acts of the story: 
For more details on how the game works, check out the Google Docs of the full rules:
Multi-Player Rules: [Google Doc]
Solo-Play Rules: [Google Doc]
For even more details, and to give the game a try, download the full grayscale print-and-play (13MB ZIP file): [download]  
How-to-Play (multi-player) Video ...
PLAY

Solo-Game Play-Through Video by Liz Davidson of Beyond Solitaire ... 
Lost from our history books, Portuguese sailor Raimundo Peres da Costa discovered a new land in the middle of the Atlantic Ocean at the cusp of the 14th century. Merely planning and gaining support for such a risk-filled journey proved a difficult path. Yet, with the sponsorship of beloved Queen Isabel of Portugal, Raimundo secured the supplies and crew needed to accomplish his dream.
Perhaps Raimundo’s story was lost for a reason. What if the first person to successfully lead a voyage to the fabled Land of Danger was … you? Let’s go back to the start -- Lisbon, Portugal in the year 1290 -- and see how things play out.
Days of Discovery is the first game in the "Tales of Danger" series. These games will tell the stories of the legendary Land of Danger -- a cluster of islands that used to be located in the middle of the Atlantic Ocean.
This first game covers the opening of the story, and the games that follow will continue down the 180-year timeline, having players explore how the first settlements were established, see how magic was revealed, and experience the conflicts that sprung up along the way.
The games will cover a range of different objectives and play styles, but will have a number of things in common:
They will be competitive multi-player games
They will each have a solo mode, designed with a small footprint
They will each follow a 3-Act story arc through the game
They will each come in the same sized box, with a similar book-like design, to look good when stacked together on a shelf
The game is packaged in a thick-walled, fully-wrapped, telescoping setup box that is designed to look like a leather-bound book.  It measures 5-1/2 x 3-1/2 x 2 inches, and is constructed from 70pt chipboard and covered in full-color printed heavy stock.
The box contains:
6 Jumbo-sized Player Reference cards
108 Poker-sized cards: 6 Sponsors, 102 People
2 Rule Books: Multiplayer, Solo-Play
3 extra zipping plastic baggies (for organizing cards)
The cards are made from 12pt 305gsm black-core card stock, and will have a semi-glossy UV-protective coating.
The box is big enough to hold all of the cards when they are sleeved.
There will be no stretch goals to unlock for this project. 
A number of preview copies of the game were sent out to various reviewers and other folks in the indie board gaming space. As their reviews are posted, I'll list them here ...
From Jason Glover, Grey Gnome Games, on BGG: "Each act uses different mechanics and feels quite different from the next, while binding well to the theme. All of this is done with one set of multipurpose cards. This is an incredible design feat."
From AJ Porfirio, Van Ryder Games, designer of Hostage Negotiator, on Twitter: "The solo play is great! I am a backer and supporter."
From Glenn Flaherty, Board Games & Bourbon, on Twitter and YouTube: "Days of Discovery is on KS and has a nice story arc: Gain a benefactor, assemble a crew, then survive your journey. It plays like Splendor, Friday, with a hit of The Grizzled. I like it."
From the TIGR review by Fairway: "Days of Discovery is a fantastic little mashup of three different card games ... If you like card games and are looking for one that plays quickly, is easily learned and can play six, this game should definitely be on your list."
From the Gameosity Review:"There's something unique about Days of Discovery - the way the three phases of the game interlock means that every decision you make has multiple consequences, and learning the ins and outs of that interplay is the heart of the game. I really enjoy the layered strategy at work here, and it's definitely the most ambitious of Matt Worden's projects so far."
From the Father Geek Review: "Matt Worden has created a wonderful game that uses simple mechanics, but feels and plays very differently through each of the three acts. Even better, each act is both a separate game and a prelude to the finale."
From the Everything Board Games Review: "The unique multi-use cards will keep us coming back to Days of Discovery. These cards combined with the three-act structure allow a lot of game to be packed in a little box."
From Tom Gurganus, Go Forth and Game: "The story being developed, both within this game and for this series, really has me hooked. And this first game in the series is a perfect way to get it started! I like the three act paradigm. It is different and each act builds into the next. That's pretty cool!"
From LizDavidson, Beyond Solitaire: "Days of Discovery is a small game, but an ambitious one. The game is definitely engaging, and I have played and enjoyed it."
There are only 4 backer pledge levels, and all have some of the shipping costs included:
Pledge $9 or more to receive a link to a full-color, 300 dpi print-and-play PDF (electronic delivery = no shipping costs here)
Pledge $29 to receive a copy of the game. (Shipping within the U.S. is included. Canada = $5 extra, Rest of World = $10 extra.) To get additional copies of the game, add $25/copy to your pledge.
Pledge $275 to have the "Noble Matriarch" Sponsor card updated to include a likeness of your face. This pledge is limited to a single backer, and includes shipping anywhere in the world. You will receive 2 copies of the game, plus a canvas print of the updated character. (My artist will need you to send in a few photos of yourself to use as a reference. I reserve the right to determine when the likeness is "close enough.")
Pledge $275 to have the "Merchant Guild" Sponsor card updated to include a likeness of your face. This pledge is limited to a single backer, and includes shipping anywhere in the world. (same rewards and extra rules as previous)
My name is Matt Worden, and I live near Minneapolis, Minnesota, with my wife, two kids, and two cats. I have been designing board games as a hobby for nearly 20 years, and had my biggest success with the 2011 Games Magazine Game of the Year -- Jump Gate ... which was also published in Europe as Space Mission.
I have been working on Days of Discovery for about 3-1/2 years, playtesting it at many Protospiel events and with independent playtesters along the way. It started out as a solo-only game, but continued to develop into the 1-6 player game it is today. To get more background on this design, read the blogs about it on my website.
Podcast Interviews: I've recently been interviewed on a couple of podcasts ...
The Game Crafter Official Podcast
Go Forth and Game
As with most of my games, I will be using The Game Crafter to produce Days of Discovery.
With their Small Stout Box and excellent playing card and rule booklet production, I am able to make the game exactly what I want it to be.  Add in their U.S. location and Bulk-Order-Fulfillment service, and the logistics of fulfillment become a lot easier.
Because of this, I consider a November 2018 delivery to be a conservative estimate.
EU-Friendly Shipping: I have found a Germany-based fulfillment partner to ship games through for our Europe-based backers!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
With any creative project that needs to be manufactured and shipped to backers, a number of things can go wrong.

However, I have done the following things to mitigate the risks ...

The game design and artwork (except for the 2 "add my face" items) are complete. The rule books have been written and gone through an initial editing pass. I am not using stretch goals to add anything new to the game during the project. I will be using an established manufacturer who will both print my games and send them directly to backers.

It is possible that unexpected delays may still occur in the final preparation of the print images -- especially related to the two "add my face" items -- or in the manufacturing and fulfillment of the orders. If anything like this occurs, I will do my best to communicate quickly and completely with all of the backers.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

I'm quite happy with everything in the box -- the cards (including the new backs), reference cards, and rules booklets. But the box needs work. Besides some minor color/brightness correction on the front and spine, I want to update the design on the back with something simpler, using larger text.

campaign.story:
When Cutie Met Patootie is a tabletop game from a rich storyline brought to you via a fun, narrative Kickstarter campaign. A narrative campaign just means that throughout this campaign, we will learn the story of the game characters through time-released animations. In fact, the first video is right above! If you are only here for the game, that's fine too! There are plenty of fun things for you to check out below. Thank you for your support and welcome to the When Cutie Met Patootie Kickstarter campaign!
Chapter 2
PLAY

In Chapter 1, we learn of how the Visitors arrived on Earth and what their mission is, outlined by the gameplay.
In Chapter 2, we are introduced to the Citizens of Kodiak Harbor and how Cutie gets mixed up in all of this.
In Chapter 3, we discover just how Rewind managed to make it to Earth in the first place.
In Chapter 4, we find out if our heroes succeed or succumb to Rewind's flood!
When Cutie Met Patootie is a turn-based resource and hand management game. In the box, you'll find 162 cards, 150 acrylic gems, and 10 Visitor Pawns.
Your goal in the game is to collect and spend gems to move the Visitor Pawns to the top of the map while making sure the Visitors end the game carrying the specific gems which earn you points.
Setup
A lifetime of map variation replayability!
Gameplay
On your turn, you have two options: You can advance one of the Visitor Pawns or distribute gems onto Visitor Cards by playing Path Cards from your hand.
Amelia advances for free, Beryl makes a "quick" advance, and Gillies makes a "slow" advance.
Advance: Using the gems from their respective Visitor Card which match their route requirement, or any two gems in place of a required color, a Visitor Pawn may advance along the path. Sometimes a Pawn may move for free if the Visitor is depicted on the Path Card in the space ahead. Only two pawns are allowed on each space.
A Gillies card was played, and Gillies collected quickly the gems from the card. However, another card was played afterward to collect slowly.
Collect Gems: To collect gems, simply play a path card from your hand to disperse the gems shown on that card to the Visitor Card(s) of your choosing. When collecting gems, players can do so slowly or quickly. Quickly means that all gems from a played Path Card depicting the Visitor are given to that same Visitor. Slowly means gems are dispersed however the player wishes otherwise. Collecting gems slowly comes at a risk!
Looks like Gillies and Amelia made it to the next level safely, but there are too many Rewind Cards! Beryl has been swallowed by the flood!
Flood Timer: Rewind is a nasty character who is currently flooding the map! Here's how that works. Every time a player collects gems slowly, a Rewind Card is added to the timer. When the Rewind Card count matches the lowest unflooded row of Path Cards, that row will flood and all Visitors on or below that level will be captured!
When the Visitors cleared the row, the flood came from the Rewind deck. Now one Rewind Card will flood the next level!
Automatic Floods: If ever all Visitors clear a row, that row is flooded by pulling directly from the Rewind Deck instead of the timer counter of cards. In this way, the pressure is always on to beat the flood!
Game End: When the last row has been flooded (Row 4 in 1-2 Player game, Row 3 in 3-4 player game), the game ends. Gems are collected from the surviving Visitor Cards and starting Gems from each surviving Visitor are added to the point groupings. Players reveal their Citizen Cards and score points based on the count of gems!
Use these free tools below to start playing today!
             Test the game for free on Tabletopia
As a backer of this campaign, you are signing up for a guarantee that the components will be of the best quality from the start. However, there is one component upgrade just out of reach which I think we all can get excited about...

That means FREE US shipping, $9 for Canada and Mexico, $8 for the EU/UK, $10 shipping in Australia / New Zealand, and reasonable rates everywhere else! Here's what that looks like worldwide.

Retailers can participate in this campaign too! Let's talk business!

             Special Thanks
My wife, Liz, supports my creative pursuits in this demanding career and I love her more and more each day for being there for me at all times, good and bad. 
Jamey Stegmaier, James Mathe, James Hudson, JR Honeycutt, Mike Paschal, Adam Clark, Dave Salisbury, Scott Morris, Marie Poole, Julie Ahern, Martyn Poole, Gabe Barrett, Eduardo Baraf, and Timothy Cassavetes have taught me many things about crowdfunding and the board game market. I would not be where I am today were it not for their guidance.
In the year I have worked for LongPack Games, my work family has taken a vested interest in my professional development, teaching me all there is to know about manufacturing and logistics. They also fully support my external obligations to crowdfunding clients and my own publishing pursuits. I am lucky to work with such a team.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This will be my first published game under The Daniel Zayas Company banner, but it is far from my first experience on the Kickstarter platform or the board game industry. I have officially collaborated on multiple campaigns as a verified Kickstarter Expert for more than a year, and before that, I helped launch 10 campaigns for a major publisher. I currently work as the US Sales Manager for LongPack Games Manufacturing and as a volunteer admin for 30+ board game industry and Kickstarter-related Facebook Groups. 

When Cutie Met Patootie is 95% complete. After the campaign's successful completion, I will have the artist get to work on the Citizens of Kodiak Harbor promo cards as well as do a couple UX touchups on the graphic design of the cards. The quotes are in from LongPack Games on production, and I have multiple quotes in place for fulfillment to backers. There really isn't much left to do on the creative side to get this in your hands. It will be mostly logistics from here on out.

As a backer, please expect monthly updates until the campaign fully fulfills. Delays are part of the process, but I have built in enough lead time that I am confident we will ship the games on time or beforehand. I consider you the backer as an integral part of this project for your investment and confidence in me. I want to be as transparent as possible with you through every step of the adventure. 

Thanks for your support and I am excited to bring When Cutie Met Patootie to your table!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
IN ENGLISH (link en ESPAÑOL)
We are giving away ALL the Stretch Goals!
The Southern Lady cuts through the waves, the water spraying your face as you stare out at the Caribbean sea. Lost in thought, you remember the first time you came across a Spanish Galleon. Few of you managed to escape that mess with your lives, but that marked the moment when you began forging your destiny as a pirate. Now, your reputation precedes you wherever you go, instilling fear among your enemies. Nothing will get in your way of becoming the most infamous pirate to ever sail the high seas…
Make your own destiny and become the terror of the seas in Skull Tales: Full Sail!
Skull Tales: Full Sail! is a pirate adventures board game with miniatures. Set sail on the Southern Lady and explore the beautiful Caribbean sea, ripe with fearsome enemies and amazing treasures. Fame and fortune await you!
Choose among twelve starting characters, each one with its own unique miniature, to be used on the different boards as you play through the game. Find all the information you need to start playing on their character sheets.
In Skull Tales: Full Sail! You’ll be able to play individual scenarios or embark upon an immersive campaign that threads several different scenarios together into one captivating storyline.
Skull Tales, created by David Illescas, is a semi-cooperative game for 1-5 players aged 14 and up. The approximate playing time in Campaign Mode is between 60-90 minutes for one scenario and about 150 minutes for a complete chapter (Voyage, Adventure and Port). The game also includes 52 miniatures - not counting stretch goals!
During the Voyage Phase, which simulates being on a pirate ship, we’ll be managing the crew that makes up our ship while we explore the map on the way towards our objective...or objectives! But, the Captain might have a hidden agenda that he/she is keeping from the rest of the crew…
Throughout this phase, characters will take on different jobs: steering the ship, managing boarding actions, cleaning up, or even fighting sea creatures. The idea is to gain the confidence of the crew, which will depend on where you place your character and how good he/she is at dealing with all the dangerous events you’ll be facing together. The Captain will be able to assign different tasks to the crewmembers, but watch out - the other pirates can conspire against him/her!
Unfortunately, but not surprisingly, there are a lot of things that can negatively affect crew's morale: hunger, losing battles, unexpected events, etc. If morale suffers too much, another pirate can organize a mutiny to take over the captaincy and benefit from its many privileges…
Characters will earn Trust Points as they carry out duties on the ship, and these points will turn into Prestige Points once the Voyage phase comes to an end. This way, your pirate will start to gain a fearsome reputation!
In the Adventure Phase you’ll explore mysterious islands, dangerous caves, and abandoned temples. You’ll also have the chance to pillage colonial villas and find legendary objects. However, there are frightening creatures and challenging enemies to face along the way.
The Adventure map develops as terrain tiles appear randomly according to the specifications of the scenario, making each game different!
On the Adventure board you’ll be able to see how much time you have left to carry out the mission, as well as the current danger level…
Enemies have cards that outline their characteristics and a corresponding miniature. Also, every opponent you face will have a behavior or AI that generates reactions at unpredictable times, making each adventure a challenge.
In the Port Phase your character can acquire new abilities and equipment by interacting with the residents of Tortuga Island and visiting its different locations. But be careful, this place hides secrets that can make a pirate’s fate take a turn for the worst.
Each player will have time units they’ll use to carry out actions, while making sure they are ready to go when the ship sets sail: heal wounds, learn abilities, make bets, listen out for rumors, equip and improve the ship, etc. Each location has an Event Deck, and there are also independent decks for Rumors and Captain Assignments.
The following list has everything initially included in the base game, not counting components that may have been unlocked during the Kickstarter campaign.
The base game box also comes with a quick-start 10 chapter campaign (Campaign I) and a couple of special scenarios.
The new Skull Tales miniatures have been completely remodeled and will be made with a high quality plastic that is flexible, easy to paint, and allows for more clearly detailed figures. We have already started testing and the results are spectacular.
The scale of the miniatures is approximately 30-32mm up to the eye-line and not including the base.
 (Images courtesy from Icue)
PIRATE contest! (Unlocked): Share videos, photos or audio files of your family and friends with a pirate theme. If we get 200 interactions, between Twitter & Facebook, we will include a sliding chest box to store our booty (80x80x50mm) for all the backers of the game. Additionally, we will include a new Journey card dedicated to the crew of the best submission, as well as a gift for the winning crew.
For more information.
For more information: See all our booty: the first 46 Stretch Goals.
$431000 (Unlocked, Free Expansion): New Enemy: Amazons (6 miniatures). They were strong, muscular women with a height that surpassed our tallest men. They seemed taken by some strange trance, as their rage was supernatural… The true Amazonians arrive, whose legend gave name to one of the most famous rivers in the world. These warrior princesses are willing to fight to the last woman, and woe the man who stands in their way! 6 Amazonian miniatures with enemy card.
$438000 (Unlocked, Free Expansion): New cards for the incident deck, adding 4 new dangers to our adventures.
$445000 (Unlocked, Free Expansion): We are changing four small tile designs into two large tile designs to give scenarios more variety. This double-sided tile is like the Village tiles in that it is 4 times bigger than the smaller ones.
$460000 (Unlocked, Free Expansion): New Enemy: Stranglers (4 miniatures). We came ashore in the midst of a frightful fog – you could barely see your hand in front of your face. The vast mounds of seaweed were beyond anything natural, suggesting that the tide in this area was stronger and pulled any marine life from the depths of the sea onto the beaches. When the seaweed began to move, I felt as though someone was strangling me to death. Fear overcame me, especially when I saw our pistols did little damage against the shapes covered in seaweed. Another enemy comes to join the rest of the abominations. On this occasion, we’re releasing 4 Strangler miniatures and their enemy card.
$467000 (Unlocked, Free Expansion): 4 Equipment Cards (2 models). You won’t believe the beauty that I found on the last galley captured by the Brotherhood… Our market keeps on receiving new merchandise to equip your pirates with the best against their enemies. 2 x Light Blunderbuss: able to fire at adjacent enemies, but with a shorter range than pistols. 2 x Poison Vials: choose a melee weapon at the beginning of the adventure. That weapon inflicts an additional wound.
$487000 (Unlocked, Free Expansion): Tarantula Anansi (Giant miniature). And Anansi came from the shadows, wrapping that pirate up in a cocoon of silk, making quick work of the poor lad… The powerful tarantula Anansi has arrived to Skull Tales: Full Sail! the Caribbean will never be safe with the presence of this supernatural beast. This time, we’re adding an enemy that brings new game mechanics with enemies that take up four spaces. The Tarantula Anansi is represented by a miniature the size of 4 spaces, and comes with her corresponding enemy card.
$494000 (Unlocked, Base Game): 5 Port Events. The chapel was quieter than usual, the silence falling over the silhouettes as they brought their offerings. This didn’t feel right… Five new events to add variety to the Port Phase.
$509000 (Unlocked, Free Expansion): Campaign V complete. The Brotherhood has received what at first was thought to be a Royal order. After the initial refusal to carry it out, it has become an ultimatum. They have been accused of being behind a series of supernatural events that is reducing the free labor population in the colonies and negatively affecting profits from the slave trade. Either the Brotherhood takes charge of solving this mystery, or the British Empire will bring down all its might upon Tortuga Isle. The only clue that we have involves the appearance, however strange, of huge amounts of spider webs after each event…
$516000 (Unlocked, Free Expansion): 4 Equipment Cards. You have asked us on many occasions and our armorer has listened…we’re adding one more copy of the Net, Hook, Bandoleer, and Shovel cards.
$530000 (Unlocked, Free Expansion): Character: Swordsman.  "He spent years searching for his mother’s assassin. But, although he is a master fencer, his sanity is fading away, and he now spends most of his day accusing anyone who crosses his path: “You killed my mother... prepare to die!"
We’re going to add 6 Final Boss designs to the enemy cards. Each boss will have its own personalized characteristics with different behaviors and abilities. Tlanchana, the queen of the mermaids; Oggum, herald of Yemayá; Charles Vane, Captain of the Black Sails; and Anansi, the avatar tarantula. We kept rummaging through our last treasure chest and we’ve found a pack of more than 5 cards that are being added to the ones already unlocked. What surprises are to be found on these cards?
Go to your pledge, use the "manage my pledge" button and manually add the amount of US$ for everything you would like to add. When the campaign is over, we will do a Pledge Manager that lets you confirm all of the details of your pledge.
40 Metal Pirate Coins: We have listened to the requests of many of you, and we can finally announce our new ADD-ON with 40 aged metal coins of 25mm in diameter and a thickness of about 1.5-1.8mm. With our own spectacular design, this great set of coins will bring: 20 coins in copper color, 10 in silver and 10 in gold.
Set of 12 Doors & 5 Chests: This $18 ADD-ON is for those of you want to upgrade those tokens and replace them with miniatures, or even to use them in other games. The chests are placed over the target tokens, and the doors are to be used in spaces of buildings and rooms in the Village. This set will come in a 17x13x3cm cardboard box.
Set of 10 custom Dice: we bring you a new add-on with a spectacular design, to make your games of Skull Tales: Full Sail! even more thematic. Ten dice with a very exclusive design, with custom faces, and in two different colors, bone white and ash gray. Are you ready to test your luck for just $14?
Wooden Dice tower in sight! We are proud to announce that we have a final design! It’s very easy to set up and it can be dismounted just as easily, without the need for glue. This add-on will come with its own cardboard box. You can take a look at how it works in the following video…More information.
The Twins: two miniatures representing the Twins Characters, controlled by one player, with two Character cards and exclusive equipment.
Sea Miniatures for Voyage Phase: 11 miniatures to replace the tokens in the Voyage Phase.
For backers of the previous publisher, we’ve included a new customized ADD-ON with the 3 new Sea Miniatures and the Sea Monster for $9.
Witch and Freedman miniatures for those of you that couldn’t get these figures in the game three years ago.

The Timeline for “Skull Tales: Full Sail!” includes some leeway for "any unforeseen problems" and we feel confident we can deliver on schedule.

campaign.story:
Dual Powers: Revolution 1917 is an area control strategy game for 1-2 players. Each player directs the forces of the conservative Provisional Government or the socialist activists of the Petrograd Soviet in a struggle for power and influence that will shape Russia’s future and either launch or suppress the impending civil war.
In Dual Powers: Revolution 1917, each game round is divided into 5 phases --  the Draw Phase, the Objective Phase, the Action Phase, the Scoring Phase, and the Cleanup Phase. 
DRAW PHASE - Each player draws 5 command cards. 
OBJECTIVE PHASE - Each player selects a secret objective, placing it face down on the game board. 
ACTION PHASE - Taking turns, each player plays 4 command cards to recruit units, move units, refresh units, or take a leader's special ability. With each card played, the date on the calendar advances, and players will sometimes earn a bonus action. 
SCORING PHASE - Up to 3 regions of the board are scored based on which player has the greatest strength, including the region of unrest, and each of the players' secret objectives. Tokens in the scored regions are exhausted. 
CLEANUP PHASE - The region of unrest and the placement of the blockade token changes. All played cards and the players' secret objectives are discarded. 
If either player moves the marker on the support track to the "victory" space on their side of the board, they immediately win. Otherwise, at the end of the round in which the month marker is on the October space or later, the game ends and the player with the most support is the winner!
Want to take a closer look to how the game works? Download the beta version of the rulebook.
English
Italian
Greek
German
Russian
Want to experience how Dual Powers: Revolution 1917 plays before pledging? Go ahead and download the FREE print and play version, grab some tokens and try it yourself!
Dual Powers: Revolution 1917 is available to play for free on Tabletopia! 
Note: Tabletopia is a sandbox board game room - there are no rules enforced, so you do need to read the rule book before playing.
"If you guys like games like Twilight Struggle or 1960, if you like these thematic games / historic games, I think this may be the game for you.  A lot of interesting decisions in the game." -- Jeremy Salinas, Man vs. Meeple
"Dual Powers is easy to learn, and difficult to master. Players will continually explore layers of deep strategy every time it hits the table!" -- Derek Funkhouser, Boardgame Spotlight
"Super Dynamic.... creates for really fun head-to-head play.... It plays pretty quickly and works well. " -- Eduardo Baraf, Pencil First Games
 "It’s a card-driven game. It’s an engine I like very much, a mechanic I like very much when it comes to historical games....This is a fun game that I find quite enjoyable.” - Marco "Wargamer" Arnaudo, Game Reviewer
"This is the highest rating I've ever given a Kickstarter preview, and the game totally deserves it!... Honestly, I don't have any criticisms of the game. It's easy to learn, fast to play, balanced, exciting, fun, and even a bit educational. There's nothing here not to like." - George Jaros, Game Reviewer at GJJ Games
“I played Dual Powers as a prototype more than a year ago during development, and I wished I could buy it on the spot! The game has a high degree of strategic depth and subterfuge that cleverly emulates the time period and events it represents.” - Scott Bogen, Game Reviewer for the Boardgame Show
"Dual Powers has all the elements of a classic card game and the feeling of a tight 2 player war game. Lots of double thinking your opponent and hoping your long term strategy pays off. Can't wait to see this in print!" - Jeph Stahl, co-designer of Academy Games' Birth of America series
"I'm a Kickstarter curmudgeon. Despite hanging out and running campaigns on Kickstarter for years, I have yet to back a single game. That's changing when Dual Powers goes live. I love everything about it: the viscerally beautiful art, the original mechanics (OH THE CALENDAR MECHANIC), the fact that it's tuned like a fine Stradivarius for one and two players, and most of all, the way a few simple rules magically conspire to thrust me into the middle of the Russian Revolution. I'm beyond smitten." -- Nick Bentley, designer/developer/marketer at North Star Games (Evolution, Happy Salmon)
"Dual Powers is a smart, engaging mix of modern and traditional gameplay. Cleverly invoking what’s fun — and familiar — about cribbage, it goes on to deliver a completely new experience set against a flavorful historical backdrop. The first time I played Dual Powers, when the game ended, I demanded that we immediately play again. If you enjoy games like Twilight Struggle, you owe it to yourself to try Dual Powers." - Jeff Tidball, designer/writer (Horus Heresy, Pieces of Eight, Dragon Age RPG)
"I actually like how the game feels, plays and looks. I do get that feeling of being immersed in the political upheaval but in a light, slightly removed, almost passive way... I was surprised that this fairly simple game packs in a great deal of solo entertainment." - Giles, Game Reviewer for Both Sides of My Table.
"I love it!" - Josef, playtester, age 8
Shipping is included to the US

+$20 to everywhere else 
Shipping charges are automatically added after selecting a pledge level.
We are proud to partner with Quartermaster Logistics, the premier provider of Kickstarter fulfillment in the gaming industry. Your games will be safely packed by their professional team, and you’ll be emailed a tracking number when your package ships. Learn more about Quartermaster Logistics at qmlogistics.com.
Brett Myers is experienced board game designer and a playful learner. Dual Powers will be his fourth published game. His previous work includes Rome: City of Marble, from R & R Games, Nanuk, from Steve Jackson Games, and The Lord of the Rings Dice Building Game, from WizKids Games. Brett runs a weekly game group called Madison Board Games and Beer, which meets every Tuesday at a neighborhood pub in his home town of Madison, WI. He blogs at www.playwithoutfear.net, where he writes about his design process and experiences. Brett also loves cooking, gardening and brewing beer.
The illustration in Dual Powers was done by the talented Kwanchai Moriya. Kwanchai is a versatile artist with multiple styles. He has worked on other board games such as: Flip Ships, Dinosaur Island, Kokoro, Catacombs, Island Hopper, Coaster Park, Kepler-3042, Einstein, Capital Lux, Kodama The Tree Spirits, Days of Ire, and many more. Check out his latest stuff over at http://www.kwanchaimoriya.com. 
Printing a board game is expensive and Thunderworks Games is a small company. Without the help of backers on Kickstarter, Dual Powers: Revolution 1917 simply will not exist. I need your support to make this game a reality. The design is complete. The art is complete. Now, all I need is enough people who think Dual Powers is as cool and fun as I do to join me and we can fire up the printing press!
Backer Benefits!
Upgrade the Game - With each stretch goal reached, the overall quality of the game will improve the overall quality of the game for all gamers.
Be Part of the Journey - Thunderworks games is known for being transparent in the production process. Get exposure to each step of the process from funding to delivery!
Support a Small Publisher - Help a small independent publisher bring great games to life.
Early Access - Backers will be first to get their games. Receive the game before it hits retail.
Help us spread the word! Share, follow, like, thumb, tweet, or whatever else you can think of!  
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/thunderworksgames  
Twitter: https://twitter.com/thunderworksgam  
BGG Page: https://www.boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/241987/dual-powers-revolution-1917
This is Thunderworks Games' fifth project funded through Kickstarter. All previous projects have been delivered to backers -- Bullfrogs, Roll Player, Roll Player: Monsters & Minions, and Blend Off! We plan to also deliver this great game to you with good/frequent/honest communication within a reasonable timeline. I truly believe in this project and I'd appreciate your support. I am dedicated to transparency throughout this campaign. This game is for you, the gamer. Let's explore the political tension and struggle during the rise of the Soviets in Russia in 1917 and make Dual Powers: Revolution 1917 a reality together. 
If you have any advice, comments, questions or just want to say hi, please feel free to contact me through the "Contact me" link under my bio on this page. Or send me an email at keith@thunderworksgames.com.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Every project has risks. I've outlined some common areas of risk in board game projects and how I've done my best to address them.

> Artwork: All the artwork for the game is complete, with the exception of any images added due to achieving stretch goals or any last minute tweaks before sending the final files off to the manufacturer.

> Component Quality: I've worked with and built a great relationship with one of the best game manufacturers around, Panda Game Manufacturing (www.pandagm.com). Their proven track record on games like Eclipse, Terra Mystica, Pandemic, Belfort, and Mice & Mystics, proves they make great games with a high standard to quality. They also printed all previous Thunderworks Games titles including Bullfrogs, Blend Off!, Roll Player, and Roll Player: Monsters & Minions.

> Delivery Timeline: Unexpected delays out of my control can always occur (i.e. component shortage, manufacturer issues, customs delays, etc...). For the production schedule of Dual Powers, I've used conservative estimates to account for unknowns and bumps in the road.

> Fulfillment: I have received multiple estimates and will be working with established fulfillment companies that have proven track records for delivering quickly and efficiently all over the world.

> Fifth Project: Even though this is my fifth Kickstarter project, I have continued to spend endless hours researching Kickstarter as well as participating in many Kickstarters. I have done my best to foresee and minimize any obstacles or stumbling blocks.

In addition, in my life outside of this campaign, I have over a decade of project management experience on large-scale software projects. I will continue to leverage that experience and apply it to this project by anticipating issues and sidestepping hurdles that may arise.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Since September of 2011, The Secret Cabal Gaming Podcast has been creating highly produced audio podcasts about tabletop gaming. Over the years we have expanded to 5 full length podcasts per month covering board games, role playing games and miniatures gaming. We've also produced audio dramas, video blogs and more. This fundraiser will ensure that the Cabal continues to produce all of this content and more over the next year! 
These are the items that you will receive in the reward bundles.
Part of the fun of creating things and also creating stuff! The Secret Cabal works hard to create interesting backer rewards that are nearly all are designed by Jamie.
Promo Pack includes all of the above promotional cards for board games. All of the other goodies listed below are individually listed within the backer levels.
WHAT ABOUT SHIPPING?
Shipping is the most difficult part of running any Kickstarter. We are running this project to facilitate making as much content as we can and too many campaigns have been sunk by botched shipping. Each pledge including physical rewards will have a shipping and handling cost added to it. 
US Shipping: $5 ($3 for just the promos) 
Canadian Shipping: $12 ($10 for just the promos)
Everywhere Else: $15 ($13 for just the promos)
Shipping for Grand Adventures Print version adds $2 for Canadian and international pledges.
Shipping For Add Ons
Shipping will be added per add-on based on the item and it's destination via a pledge manager after the campaign closes.
We very much appreciate your understanding as we are attempting to minimize our risk and make sure you get all your goodies! 
NOTE ABOUT BACKER LIMITS: So you may notice that there are actually limits on a the backer levels. The reason this is is that the reward promos are donated by publishers and they only have the ability to provide a certain number of them to us - roughly 1500. We cant exceed those limits. So we have those limits imposed on all the levels that receive promos. If by some strange and amazing circumstance we completely run out of the 1500ish promos during this campaign, will will continue with backer levels sans-promos. It's a good problem to have I suppose.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Really the only risk involved with any of this are your normal every day risks of life. I fully plan to continue working day in and day out on the content promised in this Kickstarter but health, accidents or general emergencies are the only things that I think could stop me from the duties I've chosen to take on with this project. Honestly, I'm stretching here to find some risks involved with backing this project... but you know... the "Risks and challenges" section was here with an empty form field so I filled it out.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Grand Adventures Sample Print Arrived and It Looks Awesome!
updates.update_content:
Hey Now Everyone! 
It's finally here! The sample printing of Grand Adventures as arrived today and I'm so happy with how it came out. The covers looks beautiful, the pages/printing are great and Steve's artwork is... well it's stunning.  Check below for some photos and a quick flip through video.
I did find a couple of small errors I need to fix in this one, but they're nothing that will require another sample print. Just a tweak here, a tweak there and I'll send it out for a mass printing.  (For example, the front and back covers are just a few millimeters off center and I found 2 grammar mistakes in the last minute page I wrote)

updates.update_userinfo: Grand Adventures: Proofreading finishing this week, then print!
updates.update_content:
Hey Now Everyone! 
On the podcast this week I'm throwing out an update regarding Grand Adventures and wanted to share here as well. Right now, the writing, artwork, forward, words of wisdom, layout and design are all complete. As I'm wiring this, the book is in the hands of a professional proofreader to make sure that I don't embarrass myself with spelling and grammar mistakes. They promise that they will have it back to me no later than Thursday of this week (June 27th). When It's returned, I'm going to go through the edits to make sure they didn't change anything they weren't supposed to and assuming they didn't, we're ready for print.
